intro: Descurainia intermedia, commonly known as yellow tansy, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many cruciferous plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a slightly hairy texture. Descurainia intermedia is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields.
